group_1.narration: "The ambulance is here, hurry up!@We'll prioritize evacuating the children@from the first row!"
"What are you doing?@It's pitch black down there!"

group_1.textCenter: I thought I could finally get away with not believing@in the will of the universe this time...

group_1.textLeft: That's not right.@Kurara's injuries are way worse than mine!
I want Kurara to be carried first!

group_1.textRight: ...Urara-chan, I'm sorry.

group_1.textLeft: Professor, please tell them that, too!

group_1.textRight: She's... Urara, she's not going to make it.

group_1.textLeft: That's not true, y'know... We were together just a@moment ago...she was supposed to be fine...

group_1.textRight: It seems like you're in trouble, Urara Yume.

group_1.textLeft: Kyubey...

group_1.textRight: Wait, is Kyubey there?@No, you can't make a contract, don't do it...!
Don't you have a wish you'd like to have fulfilled?
Urara-chan!
Well then, Urara Yume.
What kind of wish would you like to have fulfilled in@exchange for your soul?

group_1.textLeft: Please, I'm begging you! Save Kurara!

group_1.textRight: Urara...!!

group_1.textLeft: KURARA!

group_1.textRight: Urara, I fell off the bus and ended up inhaling a@ton of smoke...
Wait, that ring on your finger... Could it be...?!

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, Kurara, I became a Magical Girl!@That's how I was able to save you, see...

group_1.textRight: Why...?

group_1.narration: "I've never seen...such a terrible accident before..."
"Most of them aren't going to make it..."
"Even if we lift it up, there's nowhere to put it!"

group_1.textRight: How could you...?

group_1.textLeft: What...?

group_1.textRight: Why did you only save me?@You could have prevented the accident altogether...

group_1.textLeft: Ah... I was so focused on saving you, I lost sight of@everything else...

group_1.textRight: So you just let the others die...?

group_1.textLeft: It's not like I...just stood by and watched them die...!

group_1.textRight: You always act impulsively like that, don't you,@Urara...
It's all thanks to you that I've been dragged into this@whole Magical Girl mess.
Seriously, almost dying once is not a@laughing matter...
You're so self-absorbed that you can't even see@what's happening around you...

group_1.textCenter: Look, I'm sorry for everything I did before!@But this time, I just wanted to save you!

group_1.textRight: [flashEffect:flashWhite1]Get your hands off me.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:103601:effect_shake]―?!

group_1.textRight: Magical Girls are nothing but a bunch of@self-centered jerks who rely on wishes to get by.
Trying to twist fate like that just proves you were@scum from the start.
I'm glad someone like you, scum of the same ilk,@finally got what you deserved.
*Sobs*...Aaaahhh...!

group_1.textLeft: We didn't know what the Witch had done before@we defeated it...
I'm truly sorry that it had to end like this...
I'm so sorry, Urara.
You made a contract with Kyubey because you@believed in us...

group_1.textRight: I'm sorry, I couldn't stop you...

group_1.textLeft: In a situation like that, she wouldn't have been able@to hear the Professor's voice.
But, what does this mean...
Is there no way for us Magical Girls to find salvation?
Just as the Professor hypothesized...
Is there no choice but to surrender to the universe's@immunity and be driven to our demise?

group_1.textRight: It's deeply...agonizing...
But there's only one way to secure the future for@Magical Girls.

group_1.textLeft: That is...

group_1.textRight: Once all the Magical Girls and Witches in the current@world are eliminated,
after establishing a tradition where Magical Girls@aren't born...
We may not be able to reduce their numbers to@zero, but we can significantly decrease them.
Given our uncertainty about the universe's@self-cleaning process,
it might be wise to create a world devoid of@Kyubey's interference.

group_1.textLeft: Are you truly serious...?

group_1.textRight: No, I don't want to believe in that yet.
I refuse to succumb to despair as long as there are@people I want to save...
However, if something similar happens again,
we should accept that we cannot escape the will@of the universe.
[chara:802401:effect_shake]*Cough*, *cough*!

group_1.textLeft: Professor...!
Your hand...there's blood...

group_1.textRight: I'm truly relieved that I vanished from my@daughter's sight when I did.

group_1.narration: No more anger, no more sadness, just an endless desert@spreading throughout the heart, bereft even of wind.@This is what it means to choose resignation.
Perhaps we can finally acknowledge that we've@succumbed to resignation without denying it.
My heart has turned to stone,@impervious to pain, incapable of bleeding.
When I look to the future, all I see is emptiness.@Yet, I find myself lying there, pierced through.
But, Rabi says she can still hear the@sound of her own struggle to find hope...
Regardless of the impact of our actions on others,@if the universe decrees that a Magical Girl's path@remains unyielding,
then after this final attempt,@I truly wish to embrace resignation...
